Module org.tquadrat.foundation.util
Package org.tquadrat.foundation.util.stringconverter

Class DoubleStringConverter

java.lang.Object
org.tquadrat.foundation.util.stringconverter.NumberStringConverter<Double>
org.tquadrat.foundation.util.stringconverter.DoubleStringConverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, StringConverter<Double>
@ClassVersion(sourceVersion="$Id: DoubleStringConverter.java 1060 2023-09-24 19:21:40Z tquadrat $") @API(status=STABLE, since="0.0.6") public final class DoubleStringConverter extends NumberStringConverter<Double>
The implementation of NumberStringConverter Double.

The double literals are expected in the format as they are emitted by Double.toString(double); in particular, it expects decimal points instead of decimal commas for each locale.
Author:
Thomas Thrien (thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org)
Version:
$Id: DoubleStringConverter.java 1060 2023-09-24 19:21:40Z tquadrat $
Since:
0.0.6

  • Method Details

    • parseNumber

      protected final Double parseNumber(String value) throws NumberFormatException
      Parses the given String to a number. The String is not null, not empty, and it will not contain blanks only. Leading or trailing blanks have been cut off.
      Specified by:
      parseNumber in class NumberStringConverter<Double>
      Parameters:
      value - The String to parse.
      Returns:
      The number.
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - The given value cannot be parsed to a number.

    • provider

      public static final DoubleStringConverter provider()
      This method is used by the ServiceLoader to obtain the instance for this StringConverter implementation.
      Returns:
      The instance for this StringConverter implementation.
